page.title: 13Motorway Comes To Codsall
page.content: The Grecian Temple, Chillington Woods,a fine address,a deserted lodge a half mile or so within the woods of a park set out by Capability Brown in the late eighteenth century. On a cloudy night it was surrounded by blackness, its out line barely visible. The silence almost deafening,interrupted only by the eerie calls from the woods and nearby lake.In the daytime a more idyllic place could not be imagined. The drive from the gates transported one back to past eras being lined with mature, mixed woodland redolent of the atmosphere and times of Charles II and the Royal Oak, not three miles away across the fields. Nearing the Temple, Chillington Pool comes into view-silent,inviting yet daunting. In front of the Temple, 'Capability' had placed a grassy avenue leading to the pool, and at the rear, the cottage attached was surrounded by tall trees.
